meanings.definition: a line on a map connecting points of equal gravity
meanings.sent1: The isogriv on the map showed where the gravity was the same.
meanings.sent2: I studied the isogriv on the map to understand the gravity distribution.
meanings.sent3: The isogriv on the map decided where the gravity party would be held.
meanings.sent4: Her smile created an invisible isogriv connecting our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The isogriv on the map looked like a wavy river of gravity.

meanings.definition: to delineate or mark with isogriv lines
meanings.sent1: He carefully isogrived the map to show the gravity distribution.
meanings.sent2: She will isogriv the map to highlight the areas of equal gravity.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to isogriv the playground with chalk lines.
meanings.sent4: His words isogrived a clear path for us to follow.
meanings.sent5: The artist isogrived the canvas with colorful lines of gravity.

meanings.definition: having the characteristic of isogriv lines
meanings.sent1: The map displayed an isogriv pattern indicating equal gravity.
meanings.sent2: The scientist explained the isogriv nature of the map markings.
meanings.sent3: The isogriv cupcakes all had the same amount of frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had an isogriv design that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The room had an isogriv feel with everything symmetrically placed.
